definition: to part with sth cherished/to forsake
to cut/to cut apart
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures

sentences.english: Your love is too easy to sell, the next instant to deletion.
sentences.chinese: 你的感情太易割愛，把未來轉眼就刪改。

sentences.english: Did you know that I am also your fan, but I am willing to reluctantly part with.
sentences.chinese: 您清楚我也是您的影迷，不過我願意忍痛割愛。

sentences.english: When this happens, it’s best to bite the bullet and drop or delay a project or two.
sentences.chinese: 當這發生時，最好忍痛割愛，放棄或推遲一兩個計劃。

sentences.english: Would you live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得輕鬆自在，時時都要忍痛割愛。

sentences.english: If you would live with ease, do what you ought, and not what you please.
sentences.chinese: 要想活得輕鬆自在，時時都要忍痛割愛。

sentences.english: Are you willing to part with that toaster?
sentences.chinese: 那臺烤土司機你願意割愛嗎？

sentences.english: He beguiled me into parting with the gem.
sentences.chinese: 他誘騙我把那枚寶石割愛。

definition: posthumous work
to pass (sth) on (to sb else)/to transfer sb (to another hospital etc)
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
to drop (subject etc)
unwilling
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
to have no other choice
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
to be determined to/to insist on
(literary) we/us
to pass on a present
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
penniless (idiom)
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to decline (an appointment, invitation etc)
to return with thanks/to give back (honorific)
